intro: Walsura robusta, commonly known as the Indian tamarind, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces elongated, pod-like fruits that contain sweet, sticky pulp and flat, edible seeds. It thrives in humid climates and is often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is cultivated in various parts of its native range.
